properties.name: product id
properties.description:
The product id of the Recipe is the unique identifier of the specific Product  that will result from following this Recipe. 

(Note: Product is part of the PRODUCT domain, which is to be defined as of v0.3.3 of this model)

properties.name: recipe version
properties.description: This is the version of the recipe.  In SCADA this is a single integer that increments with each revision.

properties.name: event acknowledged by person id
properties.description: The event acknowledge by person id is the unique identifier of the person who has acknowledged this Process Event.

properties.name: manufacturing process person name
properties.description: This is the version of the recipe.  In SCADA this is a single integer that increments with each revision.

properties.name: production run start date-time
properties.description: This is the version of the recipe.  In SCADA this is a single integer that increments with each revision.

properties.name: production run end date-time
properties.description: This is the version of the recipe.  In SCADA this is a single integer that increments with each revision.

properties.name: product batch date-time
properties.description: This is the version of the recipe.  In SCADA this is a single integer that increments with each revision.

properties.name: PROCESS Domain CDM
properties.value:
# Digital Membership
## PROCESS Domain Logical Data Model

- author: timothy.galvin@atos.net
- version: 0.3.4
- date: 20-jan-2024

This is the PROCESS Domain LDM for the Digital Membership data architecture.  This provides a specification for the data objects and their interrelationships that govern the business aspects of medicines manufacturing process with the Digital Membership.

The starting point for the definitions in this CDM is the OPC UA 10000 Specification (v.1.05.03)

properties.name: TODO
properties.value: Determine if the "Process Event Recipe".configuration should be a set of values within the join entity, or broken out in to a separate entity.  Simplify for now (as of 0.3.2).
